about.title: About
about.html:
Bicycle Route Planner is capable of computing routes for cyclists from an origin to a destination. It solves the multi-criteria bicycle routing problem based on a formal model expressive enough to represent transport network features and cyclists' preferences grounded in the studies of real-world bicycle route choice behaviour. Our solution employs the heuristic-enabled multi-criteria label-setting algorithm together with a combination of heuristic speedups enabling fast query runtimes. We optimise for three criteria: travel time, cycling stress, and physical effort.

Bicycle Route Planner is developed by the Agent-based Computing for Intelligent Transport Systems group, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Czech Technical University in Prague.

As one of the data sources for routing, Bicycle Route Planner uses OpenStreetMap maps, a collaborative project to create a free editable map of the world based on the Open Database License.

feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.rating-title: How do you like the route?

checkbox-1.label: Forbidden manoeuvers
checkbox-1.description: - e.g. go right, when forbidden by sign

checkbox-2.label: Bad profile corespondence
checkbox-2.description: - suggested route doesn't match selected profile

checkbox-3.label: Dangerous places
checkbox-3.description: - there is dangerous place on route

checkbox-4.label: On pavement
checkbox-4.description: - route uses pavement when not needed

checkbox-5.label: Bad map data
checkbox-5.description: - map data strongly differ from reality

body.title: Do you want to incorporate cycleplanner into your apps?

description.html: For the private early access send an e-mail to jan.hrncir@agents.fel.cvut.cz. Just write "I want Cycleplanner API!" to the subject and your reason in the message body.
